verses.verse: When Efrayim <S%H669><s%> spake <S%H1696><s%> <S%H8763><s%> trembling <S%H7578><s%>, he exalted <S%H5375><s%> <S%H8804><s%> himself in Yisra'EL <S%H3478><s%>; but when he offended <S%H816><s%> <S%H8799><s%> in Baal <S%H1168><s%>, he died <S%H4191><s%> <S%H8799><s%>.

And now they sin <S%H2398><s%> <S%H8800><s%> more and more <S%H3254><s%> <S%H8686><s%>, and have made <S%H6213><s%> <S%H8799><s%> them molten images <S%H4541><s%> of their silver <S%H3701><s%>, and idols <S%H6091><s%> according to their own understanding <S%H8394><s%>, all of it the work <S%H4639><s%> of the craftsmen <S%H2796><s%>: they say <S%H559><s%> <S%H8802><s%> of them, Let the men <S%H120><s%> that sacrifice <S%H2076><s%> <S%H8802><s%> kiss <S%H5401><s%> <S%H8799><s%> the calves <S%H5695><s%>.

Therefore they shall be as the morning <S%H1242><s%> cloud <S%H6051><s%>, and as the early <S%H7925><s%> <S%H8688><s%> dew <S%H2919><s%> that passeht away <S%H1980><s%> <S%H8802><s%>, as the chaff <S%H4671><s%> that is driven with the whirlwind <S%H5590><s%> <S%H8792><s%> out of the floor <S%H1637><s%>, and as the smoke <S%H6227><s%> out of the chimney <S%H699><s%>.

Yet I am the YY <S%H3068><s%> thy 'Elohim <S%H430><s%> from the land <S%H776><s%> of Egypt <S%H4714><s%>, and thou shalt know <S%H3045><s%> <S%H8799><s%> no god <S%H430><s%> but me <S%H2108><s%>: for there is no saviour <S%H3467><s%> <S%H8688><s%> beside me <S%H1115><s%>.
I did know <S%H3045><s%> <S%H8804><s%> thee in the wilderness <S%H4057><s%>, in the land <S%H776><s%> of great drought <S%H8514><s%>.

According to their pasture <S%H4830><s%>, so were they filled <S%H7646><s%> <S%H8799><s%>; they were filled <S%H7646><s%> <S%H8804><s%>, and their heart <S%H3820><s%> was exalted <S%H7311><s%> <S%H8799><s%>; therefore have they forgotten <S%H7911><s%> <S%H8804><s%> me.
Therefore I will be unto them as a lion <S%H7826><s%>: as a leopard <S%H5246><s%> by the way <S%H1870><s%> will I observe <S%H7789><s%> <S%H8799><s%> them:

I will meet <S%H6298><s%> <S%H8799><s%> them as a bear <S%H1677><s%> that is bereaved <S%H7909><s%> of her whelps, and will rend <S%H7167><s%> <S%H8799><s%> the caul <S%H5458><s%> of their heart <S%H3820><s%>, and there will I devour <S%H398><s%> <S%H8799><s%> them like a lion <S%H3833><s%>: the wild <S%H7704><s%> beast <S%H2416><s%> shall tear <S%H1234><s%> <S%H8762><s%> them.
O Yisra'EL <S%H3478><s%>, thou hast destroyed <S%H7843><s%> <S%H8765><s%> thyself; but in me is thine help <S%H5828><s%>.

I will <S%H165><s%> be thy king <S%H4428><s%>: where <S%H645><s%> is any other that may save <S%H3467><s%> <S%H8686><s%> thee in all thy cities <S%H5892><s%>? and thy judges <S%H8199><s%> <S%H8802><s%> of whom thou saidst <S%H559><s%> <S%H8804><s%>, Give <S%H5414><s%> <S%H8798><s%> me a king <S%H4428><s%> and princes <S%H8269><s%> ?
I gave <S%H5414><s%> <S%H8799><s%> thee a king <S%H4428><s%> in mine anger <S%H639><s%>, and took <S%H3947><s%> <S%H8799><s%> him away in my wrath <S%H5678><s%>.
The iniquity <S%H5771><s%> of Efrayim <S%H669><s%> is bound up <S%H6887><s%> <S%H8803><s%>; his sin <S%H2403><s%> is hid <S%H6845><s%> <S%H8803><s%>.

The sorrows <S%H2256><s%> of a travailing woman <S%H3205><s%> <S%H8802><s%> shall come <S%H935><s%> <S%H8799><s%> upon him: he is an unwise <S%H2450><s%> son <S%H1121><s%>; for he should not stay <S%H5975><s%> <S%H8799><s%> long <S%H6256><s%> in the place of the breaking forth <S%H4866><s%> of children <S%H1121><s%>.

I will ransom <S%H6299><s%> <S%H8799><s%> them from the power <S%H3027><s%> of the grave <S%H7585><s%>; I will redeem <S%H1350><s%> <S%H8799><s%> them from death <S%H4194><s%>: O death <S%H4194><s%>, I will <S%H165><s%> be thy plagues <S%H1698><s%>; O grave <S%H7585><s%>, I will <S%H165><s%> be thy destruction <S%H6987><s%>: repentance <S%H5164><s%> shall be hid <S%H5641><s%> <S%H8735><s%> from mine eyes <S%H5869><s%>.

Though he be fruitful <S%H6500><s%> <S%H8686><s%> among his brethren <S%H251><s%>, an east wind <S%H6921><s%> shall come <S%H935><s%> <S%H8799><s%>, the wind <S%H7307><s%> of the YY <S%H3068><s%> shall come up <S%H5927><s%> <S%H8802><s%> from the wilderness <S%H4057><s%>, and his spring <S%H4726><s%> shall become dry <S%H954><s%> <S%H8799><s%>, and his fountain <S%H4599><s%> shall be dried up <S%H2717><s%> <S%H8799><s%>: he shall spoil <S%H8154><s%> <S%H8799><s%> the treasure <S%H214><s%> of all pleasant <S%H2532><s%> vessels <S%H3627><s%>.

SHomron <S%H8111><s%> shall become desolate <S%H816><s%> <S%H8799><s%>; for she hath rebelled <S%H4784><s%> <S%H8804><s%> against her 'Elohim <S%H430><s%>: they shall fall <S%H5307><s%> <S%H8799><s%> by the sword <S%H2719><s%>: their infants <S%H5768><s%> shall be dashed in pieces <S%H7376><s%> <S%H8792><s%>, and their women with child <S%H2030><s%> shall be ripped up <S%H1234><s%> <S%H8792><s%>.
